DataElement.preferredName: Peripheral Blood Stem Cell Transplantation Infusion CD34 Cell Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Numeric value to represent the number of CD34 cells reinfused during a peripheral blood stem cell transplantation.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the infusion of CD34+ cells as part of the transplant procedure.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Healthy skin, bone, or other tissue taken from one part of the body and used to replace diseased or injured tissue removed from another part of the body.

Concepts.definition: Tissue or organ transplanted from a donor to a recipient.

Property.preferredDefinition: No value exists.:A method of putting fluids, including drugs, into the bloodstream. Also called intravenous infusion.

Concepts.definition: Any form of treatment that is introduced into the body via a blood vessel, a muscle, or the spinal cord.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

ValueDomain.preferredName: Peripheral Blood Stem Cell Transplantation CD34 Cell Value
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Similar to bone marrow transplantation, peripheral stem cell transplantation is a method of replacing the blood-forming cells lost due to high-dose chemotherapy, and possibly radiation therapy, used to destroy leukemia cells. Certain immature circulating blood cells, similar to stem cells in the bone marrow, are removed before treatment. The cells are then given to the patient after treatment to help the bone marrow recover and continue producing healthy blood cells.  Transplantation may be autologous (the patient's own blood cells are used), allogeneic (blood cells are donated by someone else), or syngeneic (blood cells are donated by an identical twin)._A protein found on the surface of some bone marrow and blood cells._The smallest units of living structure capable of independent existence, composed of a membrane-enclosed mass of protoplasm and containing a nucleus or nucleoid._A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Peripheral Blood Stem Cell Transplantation CD34 Antigen Cell Value
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Similar to bone marrow transplantation, peripheral stem cell transplantation is a method of replacing the blood-forming cells lost due to high-dose chemotherapy, and possibly radiation therapy, used to destroy leukemia cells. Certain immature circulating blood cells, similar to stem cells in the bone marrow, are removed before treatment. The cells are then given to the patient after treatment to help the bone marrow recover and continue producing healthy blood cells.  Transplantation may be autologous (the patient's own blood cells are used), allogeneic (blood cells are donated by someone else), or syngeneic (blood cells are donated by an identical twin).:A protein found on the surface of some bone marrow and blood cells.:The smallest units of living structure capable of independent existence, composed of a membrane-enclosed mass of protoplasm and containing a nucleus or nucleoid.:A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

Concepts.definition: A method of hematopoietic reconstitution utilizing stem cells harvested from the circulating blood of a patient or donor. Peripheral blood stem cell transplantation (PBSCT) is used for the treatment of certain blood disorders, following partial or complete bone marrow ablation, or following high dose chemotherapy or radiation treatment for cancer. Immature circulating blood cells, similar to stem cells in the bone marrow, are removed before treatment. The cells are then given to the patient after treatment to help the bone marrow recover and continue producing healthy blood cells. Transplantation may be autologous (the patient's own blood cells are used), allogeneic (blood cells are donated by someone else), or syngeneic (blood cells are donated by an identical twin).
Hematopoietic progenitor cell antigen CD34 (385 aa, ~41 kDa) is encoded by the human CD34 gene. This protein plays a role in cell-cell adhesion and may have a role in leukocyte migration.
The smallest units of living structure capable of independent existence, composed of a membrane-enclosed mass of protoplasm and containing a nucleus or nucleoid.
A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.
